comment.text: Ubiquitin-protein ligase that probably functions as an E3 ligase in conjunction with specific E1 and E2 ligases. May also function as an E4 ligase mediating the assembly of polyubiquitin chains on substrates ubiquitinated by another E3 ubiquitin ligase.
S-ubiquitinyl-[E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme]-L-cysteine + [acceptor protein]-L-lysine = [E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme]-L-cysteine + N(6)-ubiquitinyl-[acceptor protein]-L-lysine.

isoform.name: UFD2a-7/7a
UFD2A-III
isoform.text: Expressed exclusively in mature striated muscle cells.

comment.text: Highest expression in ovary, testis, heart and skeletal muscle. Expression is low in colon, thymus and peripheral blood leukocytes. Almost undetectable in lung and spleen.
The U-box domain is required for the ubiquitin protein ligase activity.

Proteolytically cleaved by caspases during apoptosis. Cleaved efficiently at Asp-123 by caspase-6 and granzyme B. Cleaved with approximately 10-fold less efficiency at Asp-109 by caspase-3 and caspase-7.
Belongs to the ubiquitin conjugation factor E4 family.

property.value: P:protein ubiquitination involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process

feature.description: Cleavage; by caspase-6 and granzyme B
Abolishes cleavage by caspase-3 and caspase-7.
Abolishes cleavage by caspase-6. No effect on cleavage by granzyme B.
Abolishes cleavage by caspase-6 and granzyme B.
